text: We were given the studio close to the snack bar on the first floor. It was basically a high traffic area with no privacy. We literally had people peering directly in the room at times. The guy that checked us in was very rigid and unsympathetic about the fact that we were unhappy with the location.  When we asked for a manager to try to find some resolution we were told she was not in.   When we checked back the next day we had the misfortune of dealing with Carla.  She advised us the manager was still not available.  When we asked whether breakfast was included in our room she replied, \You don't know what you paid for?\"    She said she would have the manager call us.  There was no contact about our concerns.  On the third morning we finally found someone who brought her.  We were leaving and she did not seem moved by any of our concerns either.  I was just glad to leave as I felt it was very overpriced for the poor customer service they provided.Besides the poor staff they have poorly designed bathrooms with bad ventilation
month: sinks that spray on the user as they are used and water that takes a long time to get hot.They have \"electronic\" safes that only operate via a large key which you have to carry around.I would not recommend this hotel
year: even for half of the price they are charging.  Spend your money somewhere where they at least pretend to care about customer service."

text: Everything's good. Excellent 2 bedroom apartment. Clean and spacious. Hotel swimming pools and spa in excellent condition.This is the 3rd time we have used it as a family.The only drawback is Check Out until 10am. It's incomprehensible.

No need to write much as the review by Will A from July 2025 is absolutely spot on!We (family of 4 - kids 12 and 9) preferred the quiet pool during the day and just walked down to the big pool when we fancied the slides etc. Donâ€™t listen to the moaning reviews - itâ€™s a good hotel and youâ€™ll enjoy it!Having said this, we only paid Â£3200 for the family with on the beach. We noticed that jet2 and Tui prices were closer to Â£5K. I wouldnâ€™t have been so happy if weâ€™d paid top dollar, as Iâ€™ve stayed in much better places for that sort of money!!!

Final day of the loveliest holiday at the Tivoli, my husband and I decided to come for the 2nd year as we had such an enjoyable stay last year. From our welcome on arrival (Madelina) we have been treated beautifully by all staff. Everyone works so hard to look after residents I can never understand any negative comments. So wish I knew all the names (Elini,Rodrigo,Goergio) you are all exceptional and thank you. For anyone thinking of staying you will not be disappointed itâ€™s in the most amazing location it really does take your breath away.

Fantastic holiday food in main restaurant needs to be a little hotter  but plenty of choice for everyone and pools bit chilli but this could be depending on the time of year you go definitely will return loved it and staff cleanliness are amazing ðŸ’–

Room was very clean and comfortable and the standard of housekeeping was high.  However we had paid extra to upgrade to a sea view which could only be seen by leaning over the balcony and not from the apartment.  The reception staff with a couple of exceptions werenâ€™t particularly helpful or friendly.  The restaurant is ok, we ate there on a couple of occasions in the evening and the food was fine but again itâ€™s not particularly welcoming.  Breakfast is more expensive than was advertised and there are additional supplements on most of the non buffet options.  The bar area is not particularly inviting.The resort is not on the beach and there are no hotel facilities on the beach.  The pools are nice but the adult pool is not easy to locate and the resort would benefit from better signage in general.  We had a big balcony which would have benefited from a couple of loungers or chairs to sunbathe in.  The bathrooms are nice but the shower fittings are poor and the only toiletries provided are soap dispensers.There are a couple of restaurants within walking distance but would recommend a car if you are staying here.This resort could be so much better with a bit more attention to detail and more welcoming staff

We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment  room number A0N. (We were woken at approx 5am every morning as there is a piece of land behind the rooms on this side that have cockerals on which start every morning around this time,although we got used to the noise sleep was still disturbed from this early time, not exactly what you want on holiday!)This was a great size with lovely balconies and views of one of the outside pools and also the sea. The two bathrooms were great for families and all the beds were comfortable. However in general the whole apartment needed redecoration the majority of the walls were badly marked just making it look tatty for the price we paid.Also the indoor pool area wasn't always the cleanest and the showers did tend to smell. The inside pool was the spa area so whilst children were allowed in this area this was for swimming only and not playing, jumping in etc.The Belmar is about half an hours walk to the town center at a slow pace with children ( we walked every day with three children aged 15, 12 and 7 yrs, I don't think you need a car unless your not used to walking at home. There was also a couple of shops within about 20 mins walk. There was no onsite shop which would have been useful, however the bar did sell snacks and ice creams. We enjoyed the holiday but don't think the apartment would tempt us back.

Iâ€™m in my late 20's and went there with my sister and parents, to take a holiday somewhere different and by the beach. This place was perfect for such a situation. We just wanted to relax and thatâ€™s exactly what we did. The apartment type rooms are gorgeous and just what we needed.W enjoyed preparing meals in the room after walking up the hill to the convenience store where delicious local produce can be bought. There are two restaurants on the beach â€“ services does take forever and the food is nothing to write home about. If you donâ€™t feel like preparing your own meals then the hotel restaurant is pretty good and well priced or go into town.Be aware of the local taxi drivers they take about 30mintues to arrive and then rip you off and take you the long way. To get into town it literally only takes a 5 min drive if they take you the proper way. Getting back to the hotel is easy as there is a taxi rank on the main street of town.If you are looking to party then this place is not for you â€“ it is a place to relax and enjoy life.One tip for the hotel â€“ I wish you would have provided pool service as I would have bought food and cocktails as I spent hours in the sun.

Very clean hotel. Accommodation is apartment style with kitchen and dining area.Swimming pool as usual suitable for polar bears. So cold.We were all inclusive . What a disappointment.Break was excellent. No complaints.Lunch: Starts at 12.30 and hot food will be hot. After1.00 all hot food will be cold.Dinner: Buffet style food after it is put out will remain for the duration. Cold soup, chips, meat etc. Every so often staff member appears and stirs the rice, soup with a spoon and disappears. Maybe casts a spell to reheat the food. Interesting technique>Alcoholic drinks are local and the wine available is also of a poor quality.This is not a 4 star hotel, maybe a low 3 star.Stay anywhere but here.

Yoandry, Dayana, and Rey were amazing with us and tried to include us in all the activities! They are pretty friendly and made us feel very good. They should continue like this in the coming years only I think they should do more diverse activities but I liked it a lot!

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Nice and clean rooms ( Newly renovated) great Food , fantastic breakfast buffet With omelettes and eggs of Your Choice, Nice location Close to the Beach With restaurants, bars and live Music. Friendly and serviceminded staff.

Very nice hotel with beautifulroom, and wonderful and very helpful staff. Location was just perfect, close to everything, both historical places and central city. We just walked around and enjoyed this lovely city.

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: We stayed at this property in Sept. It is beautiful. Food and beverage can be a bit pricy, but most rooms have a mini kitchen and there is a grocer across the street from the resort. Enjoy the luxury accommodations but byob

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & ChÃ¢teaux
text: Ideal location to explore Lisbon, with spacious modern rooms and an idyllic private courtyard for meals &/or cocktails.Staff was very helpful setting up reservations/activities, along with the typical hotel guest needs, but really proved their mettle during the Portugal/Spain blackout that occurred during our stay...Despite the trying circumstances (& limited updates from local authorities), hotel manager Christelle and her team remained cheerful & ever-present to take care of every possible accommodation during the ~12 hours where the entire city (& beyond) was thrown back to pre-electricity times - even providing an impromptu dinner for all guests when it became clear that city restaurants would be unable to provide service that evening.Certainly an \unforgettable\" stay - but one we'd happily re-visit due largely to the Valverde team and property."

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & ChÃ¢teaux
text: In summary:PROâ€™s- rooms were absolutely beautiful- location good. Central and in a nice tree lined road- communal areaâ€™s really beautiful- the service in terms of arranging trips, bookings for restaurants was very good. They also managed to retrieve a jumper we left in Cascais and post it onto to us in another part of Portugal. Thank you!- the staff were all really friendlyCONâ€™s- donâ€™t be misled by some of the old photos on this site. The pool is not a pool and more of a water feature.- the service in the restaurant was slow and a bit sloppy. One morning my son asked for eggs and pancetta. The plate came with no pancetta and when the waiter  returned again from the kitchen to find out why he said the kitchen said they didnâ€™t have any. Another day my son asked for scrambled eggs and pancetta and got smoked salmon and scrambled eggs. They also put each breakfast item ( beans, eggs, bacon) on separate individual saucers. This was strange- there is some building work going on directly next door. I found it  a little intrusive and could hear drilling through the walls. It was also quite noisy at breakfast

date: Sang Yoon Kimwrote a review Feb 2017
text: Staying at this hostel was an amazing experience. They had all the equipments needed for me to stay comfortably in lisbon! Their breakfast was simple but had all the necessities. Located \inside\" of Rossio train station
month: people who wants to travel abroad need to stay here!"

text: This has been, by far, the best vacation stay I have had. The included breakfasts are phenomenal and the staff are beyond amazing. Andres with his amazing recommendations/referrals, Catarina w/her unwavering help and smiles, Joana/Sara for their morning welcomes and service, amazing drinks and coffee from Eduardo, and a very talented Bruno behind the bar in the evenings. We found ourselves wanting to be on the lovely patio often due to their excellent service, food, and drinks. I will certainly be staying here every time I return to Lisbon, which I certainly hope to do in the near future.

My favorite hotel in the world so far! Fantastic location on top a high rock overlooking the ocean. Very comfortable, modern and clean. Every room has a wonderful view with balcony or terrace. Very friendly staff, good restaurant and fantastic breakfast. Two great pools, one outside and one indoor. Both with seaview. Lovely sauna with seaview and Turkish bath. Do try the massages. There are may different terraces with seats, sun beds, but the terrace on the roof is my favorite. There is not much to do in the village, but that is what I love about it. It is a cute little village, with only a few bars and restaurant away from the touristic craziness. The hotel offers a shuttle service to Funchal and offers different excursions. The hotel is great for people who just what to relax, but it is also a good base for day trips.

Had one night booked with just a standard room on points only as an exploring member. Was upgraded without asking to the top floor corner suite which was an amazing room with breathtaking views of both the river and city sides. Loved the retractable doors to really take in the scenery. The room was extremely well equipped with a full kitchen (even an oven!) as well as a laundry machine. All I can say was everything was spectacular and an amazing value for the money.

The hotel is located right off the Avenida Liberdade, 1 min. away from the Pombal metro station. It's a brisk 10-15 min. walk to the Chiado area, all on level ground.The room was clean and pretty spacious as far as European hotels go, and we had an enormous lovely balcony overlooking the city.The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.Wi-fi worked perfectly throughout the hotel.

I would like to share with you my week at the four seasons fairways in April.We arrived by cab to the fairways on the 10th April,checked in at 11:00 the villa was ready for us which was great news.This us our forth visit here the staff are very friendly,the maids do a great job and the maintenance men if you require anything doing these guys are great.i took our bikes up and they were sorted in no time big thanks to the lads.The food was up to the usual high standard we also had BBQ  packs ordered and did this at the villa.The mini bus to the beach and now Quinta shopping is great if you have no car,we are looking forward to seeing you all again in SeptemberKind regardsDarran & Andrea

We stayed two days in Lisbon and this hotel was perfect,everything at walking distance.The staff was friendly,the room small but clean,the location ok.Great breakfast with all you can ask.There's a  very good choice of restaurants nearby for dinner.

This is a 3 stars hotel with a 4 stars service. In spite of the rooms, that are not  big, but very clean, the staff is really helpful. They give you good tips to go around the city and if you go to Lisbon I recommend you to buy that hop on hop off trips (they have in the front desk). You only pay more 3â‚¬ per day than in public transports and they lead you to the most important places with a good explanation.The breakfast was also a good surprise and you are only 10 minutes walking from the city center. We enjoyed a lot our stay.

Arriving on Thursday afternoon after a long flight we were overwhelmed by the magnificent view right from our balcony : the Atlantic Ocean ,the breathtaking coastline and the vinyard where we were supposed to have dinner that same night. We enjoyed the the cordial atmosphere, the friendliness and the heplfulness of the staff - it was so relaxing to  meet people who have a smile for you or crack a joke.Whenever we had a question or a problem to solve, the people at the reception helped us in a very competent way.We also enjoyed the the delicious food at breakfast and dinner. The room big  was clean and well furnished.

date: Simon & Fiona Vwrote a review Jul 2016
text: A good hotel in which to base yourself to tour Lisbon albeit you will require taxis to get into town. The advantage of this hotel though is that it has a good swimming pool area therefore you can get good relaxation time soaking up the sun. Check-in staff very good although we struggled getting good information on restaurants from concierge. Room was a good size and a very comfy bed!

The Luna Clube hotel was a perfect choice and location for our week in Portugal. This was my first time to Portugal and I was not disappointed.  Weather great, friendly people, chilled atmosphere and stunning beaches with great views of the Atlantic from our balcony.  We were given an upgrade which was perfect.  Our room was clean, tidy and had plenty of room.  Adequate kitchen with all the essentials.  Great size bedroom with plenty of storage and very comfy beds.  All the staff from reception to the cleaners were very friendly and helpful.  Book yourself a ticket for the buffet they have in the hotel.  Plenty of food and well worth the price and with entertainment.  Entertainment not our cup of tea but it was fine and we had a very nice evening.  Nothing really to fault about the hotel.   There is a steep hill on the way back from the old town but if that is too much then there is the local train that runs every day back and forth.  Or better still walk down the beach and along into the old town which is a lot better and worth it on a beautiful sunny day.  We will be back.

Studio:Positives: friendly staff, lovely small pool area, comfortable beds, lovely bar area with reasonably priced snacksNegatives: we required a walk in shower for my husband with mobility problems, so we had the only accessible room which was a studio on the lower ground floor.  It was like being in a dungeon. There was absolutely no natural light in the room at all so always needed the lights on.Because of being below ground it was not unusual to have cockroachesThe bathroom was appalling! There was plenty of space but had not been fully utilised. There was simply a wash basin without a vanity unity or shelves. Our toothbrushes etc were kept in a carrier bag which I tied to the rail around the basin.The shower area was tiny with a seat folded against the back wall therefore making it even smaller. Again, no shelves - so shampoo, shower gel etc had to go on the floor. Water didnâ€™t drain well so each night I was mopping the floor!The apartments on the higher floors were far superior with nice sized balconies and some with sea view.  When we discovered there were private showers near the pool we tried to upgrade, sadly there was no availability.

I went to Lisbon with a group of 12 friends, so we all stood together in a room. The place was amazingly beautiful, which helped as a first impression, but the facilities and services were so good that we could not understand how the price came to be so cheap. It is set in a privileged spot, in Bairro Alto, with wonderful views and being close to the centre. The staff was really nice, spoke perfect English -as well as Spanish- and the installations were not only very comfortable and pretty, but extremely clean. I would definitely recommend this hostel to whomever that might be planning a trip to Lisbon.

This is our 2nd time to visit since Wyndham took over. Really pleasant stay. I love the proximity to the beach and boardwalk.  Room is really comfortable and kitchen area well equipped, pool area is lovely and staff are very polite and helpful
The hotel could not have been more conveniently located, the staff could not have been nicer (the girl at the front desk liked Southern accents because \they are so.....long\")
month: the rooms were clean and well appointed
year: the room was very reasonably priced..........I really can't say anything bad about it.  There was one guy at an adjoining restaurant who kept stopping people and harping about his \"pilgrim's menu special\"
extracted_date_str: but just ignore him.  Beautiful small town

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Just back from a week at Belmont Reid's Hotel   This is a certainly a 5 star hotelService great and staff so helpfulWould recommend to anybody  Great Restaurants in the hotel will review them separatelynothing was too much trouble for the staff

We stayed 3 nights at the Tivoli as we were attending a wedding. The hotel is grand & shiny upon arrival as it has been recently refurbished, the lobby majestic & as you walk past the reception area you will come to the terrace & here you will see the most impressive sights. The coves & cliffs are incredible, this hotel sits on the perfect highest point of the carvoeira village, we even saw it from the seas perspectibe as we did a boat tour, it looked magnificent. The hotel location has one of the best views i have seen( & i have been to many incredible places), but the view i got only from the hotel bar because my rooms are another story. Upon the great welcoming from the hotel staff who are super friendly, we got the 5 star treatment from all of them so helpful at all times & always smiling, we were shown to our room a suite, after seeig thr majestic view i expected something similar or even near enougn(please note we were part of the wedding party, so we hadnt booked our room a family member did), the room number was 555 upon entry we were greeted by a slick, clean,modern suite, but dark with curtains drawn, so, when i open the curtains...wow! What a view!!! There for my amazement we were in a basement, litersry beneath a street parking lot, just below street level so cars were above me, and below me what seemed like an abandoned garage entrance, with debris & rubbish just laying outside..filth!  Our room was Â£240 approx a night & not a suite with a view advertised on their site. My husband went to reception to complain so that we could be moved immediately, the reception guy complied graciously without a problem, we got an alternative room with an inner garden view, not wow but an improvement 100%. This room even had a terrace, the previous one just had windows. The room was big & airy very well decorated.  Bathroom door was a tricky to open from the inside, onetime my husband had to help me get out.Wifi is pretty bad on the rooms but near the lobby area & bars its fine.The wedding was held here in the hotel & it was a memorable one, the ceremony took place at the hotels clifftop..magical.This hotel is fantastic for couples & for a relaxing holiday. Lots to do near the hotel. Beach is down the road 10 mins ,& the village is quaint & beautiful. Breakfast was fantastic 5 star. So i wouod recomend people who love the 5 star treatment to come to this hotel, the rooms have a few teething problems but the service of chambermaids & cleaniness makes up for it. I guess you have to pay more for sea views, but the inner hotel views was fine, just make sure you dont get room  555. Do visit the Skybar have a cocktail admiring the awesome view. Please see room 555 view & then the hotel bar's balcony view attached below.

If you want a room with a view, this is it. What a magnificent setting. Everything opens out onto this magnificent view of the ocean and rocky outcrop. Everything is situated around the pool area which is magically suspended over the sea, well almost. A well appointed hotel with all the facilities. You are also a short walk away from many resturants and can via many steps get down to the beach.

My wife and I enjoyed 6 nights at this lovely hotel.Position - stunning views over the Atlantic especially when enjoying a sundowner on the rooftop bar. Easy walking distance from the marina where we counted 9 different restaurants.Room - well appointed, bath robes, lovely view over the sea from our side facing sea view room.Staff - professional, friendly and well trained. The WhatsApp system for service and maintenance issues worked perfectly.Value - exceptional, especially if you book direct and get a â‚¬25 euro per day credit for food/drink. But overall drinks and food is very good value for this standard of hotel.Food - great quality breakfast and dinner in Alhambique restaurant is quality cooking with a stunning view.Facilities- gym, spa etc but the 30 metre roof top pool is stunning.Hard to find any fault with the hotel and although we donâ€™t normally return to destinations, we will definitely come back to Saccharum

We always love visiting here because of the area and the fact that this is the best hotel - no apartments ! Hotel needs a bit of mice particularly outside and the pools are very deep and very cold. Need heating.

Had ten days here in mid May and it's a stunner - amazing architecture rightness the sea shore with views out to the Atlantic and next to a huge lavada.Rooms are great - spacious and funky. Ignore all the business about the bathroom, there is a glazed sliding door for the toilet. It's not soundproof but the design of the room makes up for it.Really nice accommodating staff and great views from all aspects. We had a side sea view room and if anything it was even better than the full view as we had the lavada and mountain views. But as they say how much time do you spend in the room - tho they had great big balconies so....We walked in to the beautiful and peaceful harbour a few minutes away and ate in the evening.  The Italian gelataria and the place next to it were brilliant - beautiful seafood, pastas and proper authentic pizzas with a salad and a bottle of wine for around 50â‚¬.The breakfast In The hotel was magnificent - a real spread of everything you could want and tables outside looking over the sea. It was a shame the tables weren't relayed when vacated - you needed to ask. Often the beautiful spread needed to be filled - bacon, eggs, still drinking water etc and it is true the tea is cold with hot milk ......couldn't quite work that out as they bring it to you when requested. Would have thought fresh hot water with a tea bag wasn't beyond the ken of man ..? I would look at this Savoy !Beautiful ( stunning in fact) infinity pool on the roof was one of its strong points - but FREEZING when we arrived and consequently empty. It did warm up as May progressed but again, with such sun around a few solar panels should give a green solution in such a new hotel.Really only picking though as staying was such a pleasure but it made the shortfalls all the more of a disappointment..On the whole, go and hope the hotel addresses the issues that everyone moans about !

Ants in the room , but not a drama, just so you know , next time maybe the ants will find their homeland. In rest service stuff etc, was excelent. I would like to swim next time in a heated swimming pool due to bad weather, would be nice to swim in hot water while raining . Thx

Great hotel in great location. Clean and comfortable with very helpful, friendly staff. Rooftop terrace is lovely for relaxing between a day out and dinner. The restaurant went above and beyond to cater to my limited digestive requirements - and they did it with smiles and good grace. Located centrally for access to attractions. The litmus test is \would you stay there again?\" Yes

Gorgeous room! Modern. Cleaned daily. Just perfect. Food was absolutely delicious. Snack bar offered beautifully presented rolls, cakes and fresh fruit. Did not try alcoholic drinks so can not comment. Wonderful piano bar.

Stayed here for a short break at the end of April. Staff are extremely helpful, attentive, and always had a smile! The rooms ate large, separate Kitchen, lounge etc. TV has lots of English channels for when the unpredictable Portuguese weather kicks in. Little touches like a bottle of bubbly and fruit delivered to the room on my Birthday was a nice suprise.I cannot find fault in this hotel. And for what I paid, very good value. Highly recommended.

I booked this hotel through Lastminute.com. Seems like a lovely place to stay at. I made a booking in July for September. I am now due to travel tomorrow but found out from Lastminute that the hotel is no longer able to accommodate me. They offered me another Pestana property which I am not happy with - a great golf resort but only for those who play golf. Since Monday Lastminute have been chasing them for another solution. But no reply. So here I am leaving tomorrow and having nowhere to stay. I don't even want to know what service I would receive if I stayed there if they cannot handle a simple book out.DO NOT BOOK THERE!

We stayed for a short break in October to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday.  There were 7 of us in our party and we all made good use of the facilities including the Magic Spa massage that my wife took advantage of.   Our 11 year old spent most of the time in the indoor pool with her grown-up siblings, whilst we relaxed around the pool.  I did venture into the outdoor pool once, but it was a little chilly at the end of October.   Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice.   We had 1 evening meal but ate out the other nights, but this was also on a par with other 4* buffets I've had over the years.  Overall I'd recommend this hotel.

Very well situated hotel for seeing tourist parts of Lisbon. Underground and buses very close and trams at a short distance. We booked a superior room - it was on the back - not a very nice outlook but very quiet - bathroom is compact but has good size shower - room has all you need including wifi and safe. Excellent continental breakfast.

I stayed here with my wife November of this year and found it excellent . We were made very welcome by all staff especially at reception and in the dining  room and greeted warmly by cleaning staff. Food was first class and the room very comfortable . I would certainly return again

The hotel has a great location, close to many restaurants, train and metro station, access to buses. Furthermore, you can go to several tourist attractions on foot. We would like to highlight the excellent service provided by the entire team, especially the Brazilian Ketty who is at the reception, very friendly and attentive throughout the stay.

The hotel is new but it is not about modern . The room is huge but I didn't enjoy it so much. It is not  clean in the room, I feel itchy when I came into the room!I will try another  as there are a lot good hotels in lisdoa, btw, lisboa is one of my fav. city in the world!

This was always going to be a bit of a gamble; thought Elvas would be an interesting, un-touristy sort of place. Actually it was more than expected. OK, so it's a 3 star, there is no minibar fridge, no wifi. But despite a lot of re-development work going on in the first floor (which was boarded up and a lot of pneumatic drills being used during the day) at night it was peaceful. There is a school nearby, so a bit of noise and the school bells marking the end of classes seemed to go on quite late. Bed comfortable, breakfast OK and lots of it. They also have a swimming pool which they seemed to take great care over hoseing it down regularly despite the heavy rainfall... Car parked adjacent to the hotel which was free. Nice staff who will happily provide a map of the city and point out the local hostelery. Price wise, really excellent value.

This amazing little B&B in the hills above Loule was the setting for my first wedding anniversary having been Wed in the Algarve the previous year. Having stayed at some of the big resorts on the Algarve coast, Casa Da Tita is by far the best place I have stayed in my 15+ years of visiting the Algarve. From the lovely breakfasts, scenic pool area and the amazing family that run it, Casa Da Tita is definitely a must when staying in the Algarve.

We stayed in Porto three nights and when we decided to extend our stay an extra day, as our budget hotel was booked, we moved to Eurostars Porto Douro.  What a pleasant surprise when we checked into the room!  Our room with a small balcony had a beautiful view overlooking the Duoro River.  The room itself was spacious and had a very nice bed and bath but it was the view that was the best.  We took a bottle of port up to the roof of the hotel where there were several tables and chairs, and enjoyed the port as we took in the view of the river, the bridge and the city of Gaia across the way.  In the evening it is absolutely beautiful.  It is about a five minute walk down to the touristy restaurants and shops.

I spent 3 nights in this hotel. The rooms were super clean and spacious. The bar is wonderful and the cocktails are excellent! I am really looking forward to coming back and I would recommend it to anyone!

We had stayed in a Vila Gale hotel before (Madeira) and hoped for the same level of comfort, service and great breakfasts. We were not disappointed.The hotel is well located for Tavira town and also for a 20 minute walk to the mouth of the river and the ferry to Tavira Island (1.50 euro pp return, but avoid dusk and the man eating mosquitos.Breakfast buffet is huge, but can be pretty busy.The hotel gym has enough well maintained and varied equipment for a good workout.

We celebrate our 1st anniversary there.Everything is perfect. food and cocktails is very good and   swimming pool is very nice good for relaxing  the service staff is amazing thank you so much. Waiting for next vacation we will back definitely thanks again

Cons: very poor service at reception. Acres of queuing and chatting the breeze while others wait. Poor directions to an apartment far away - directed to lifts that don't even go to our floor. Very hilly. Car parking virtually impossible. Thankfully, other hotels were empty.Pros: lovely pool, nice pool bar but poorly staffed. Half the time no one was there. Rooms adequate, though it took 3 days to get someone to mend my door lock. This in itself quite inconsiderate and slow. We could have been robbed.Air con was good quality. Rooms adequately furnished for AI. Took 3 days to get towels to our room. Awful service. I think the place had just reopened cos everywhere was dirty.Good CV protocols. I felt safe. Lovely location near the beach but only a few rooms overlook the beach. In the queue was an apartment owner who could not even get a pool or sea view. Boy was he mad.Food was OK, as usual, breakfast being the best meal. For some reason, on the continent the coffee machines always premix the drinks with sugar, and the cappuccino was seriously sweet with way too much chocolate added.I had to have espresso and fresh milk.Praia de Oura is lovely but hilly, and Albufeira is beautiful in summer.I would return but probably to a different hotel.

We have just arrived home from a great week at this hotelI had read the reviews before booking so did wonder how it would beIt is a beautiful place to stay The location is just greatWe were so glad we were not at the other end of town where there is just one modern hotel on top of another and building still going onWe stayed on half board basis There is a limited choice for breakfast and evening mealThe majority of visitors seem to be Dutch or German and this is reflected in the breakfast menu choices,the croisants are not like ours here in the UK or in FranceThe hotel is always peaceful and is imaculately clean throughoutWe had a room in the original older part of the building with the best view of the sea ,harbour,mountains and the town It was lovely to sit on the balcony at the beginning and end of each dayIf you have a room in the newer part of the hotel the view is just of seaThe pool area and gardens are lovely and never busy,again the views ar amazing up there You pay a deposit for a towel which is refunded at the end of the weekThe staff are all friendly especially in the restaurant at evening meal timeThe driver of the shuttle bus is quiet but he drives more cautiosly than the taxi drivers If you have chance I would recommend taking the all day trip to the north and west of the islandBedding and towels are regularly changedThe weather was always warm but mainly cloudy however when the sun did shine it was quite hot The forecast for the week was inaccurateI would recommend this hotel for couples especially who like a peaceful place to stay

Very beautiful contemporary hotel located among the vineyards on the banks of the Douro. Beautiful spacious room with a terrace which gives a magnificent view of the vineyards and the Douro. We had a very interesting wine tasting from the vineyards. This allowed us to better understand the local terroir. Very good restaurant. Excellent breakfast! Staff, smiling and friendly, the best!

The view and location is gorgeous (the pictures do not do it justice): the hotel is located on a cliff by a beach on a seemingly isolated part of the island (the nearest town is a five-minute drive). Paying for the ocean-view is absolutely worth it, it is the best we've ever seen.The room is also very big and comfortable, except for the hard mattrass and occasionally loud people outside. Since we were there over Christmas, a lot of the island's restaurants were closed and we ended up eating at the hotel's restaurant more often than we planned, which was fine but has a pretty small menu and no vegan options.

Really friendly staff that genuinely care about everyone that is staying there. Free breakfast every day with a generous cut off time of 10.30 am! Value for money dinner available every night plus pub crawl if you can handle it! Loads of walking tours too. Room was clean and had a locker/cupboard for each bed. Perfect location too, short walk from the coast and very close to lots of shops and cafes.

we had a lovely stay in hotel particuliere! It was so nice: our room was big and comfortable, the staff was really kind, and the breakfast was very good.All the hotel is cured in every single detail.Everyone was so sweet with us and thanks to that we enjoyed our stay in Porto so much.

Weâ€™re very glad we chose this charming hotel. Itâ€™s in a fabulous location, and it was very simple to reach from the airport via the super easy metro. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was excellent. There are lots of fantastic places to eat nearby, which was very much appreciated after a long day of walking. This was our first visit to Portugal, thank you Hotel Algeria for making it such a lovely experience.

date: kulbir maan mwrote a review Aug 2025
text: the buffe and very good with a lot of variety of food, the views of the pool area wonderful, we will recreate with the family

Well I had planned on wrting a review for Fenix Gardens as I had booked this hotel. On arriving there please note the Fenix Garden is around the corner from the Fenix...taxi drivers dont seem to know this and I was glad I read a review on here before we got there.So we got to check in at Fenix Garden to be told there was no hot water and we were now booked into Fenix. Excellent!!!The room was fine, 2 single beds which was weird sinced I booked a double room (confusion in Europe over double room and double bed). The location is not far from the main city and restaurants, tourist attractions, subway, etc.The front staff were very helpful I found.Breakfast was moutains and mountains of food, something for everyone.

A wonderful, peaceful place too stay.  No souvenir shops, just  lovely white washed houses, narrow cobbled streets (hilly) within the castle walls.  The hotel itself was just inside the castle gates, clean, comfortable with friendly staff.  Parking was adjacent to the hotel.  The castle looked a great place to explore but age made that impossible for us.  We did climb the ramparts to look out over the valley, with spectacular views.  It is possible to walk the perimeter, if you have a good head for heights.  There are a few eateries but touristy it is not.  A wonderful relaxing stop over en route from Spain to Portugal.

The Altis Belem lived up to expectations, it was a fabulous hotel to stay in. The location, the room, the staff the food, everything was excellent.  We arrived disheveled around 11 in the morning, after a flight delay left us sleeping in Barcelona airport, and the staff were so sympathetic they fast forwarded our check in process and sent us straight to our fabulous room. In no time we were refreshed and lying by the pool.  I would highly recommend this hotel and its location to anyone visiting Lisbon.

Yoandry,Cinder,Nirma,Leyanna and the singer Dayana and the choreographer Lauro, great night they made my night. The costumes were very good. They invited us for a dance which was good fun. The salsa dance was the best would recommend for any party

It only costs around Ã¢â€šÂ¬10-12 to get a cab there from the airport, as soon as you arrive you're welcomed by nice friendly staff. You need to pay Ã¢â€šÂ¬5 deposit for your key but it's one of them that is on your arm like a watch so you can't lose it.The room i stayed in was a 6 bed mix dorm which had a really nice ensuite shower/toilet and a big drawer under the beds to keep your things inside which you should lock with your own padlock. The centre of the room was pretty spacious and there was a fire escape which you can go up or down out of the balcony too.We were on the 2nd floor so we were slightly lazy and used the lift on the odd occasion where there were signs giving you travel tips as well as advertising their dinner & pub crawl which only cost Ã¢â€šÂ¬20 altogether!The lobby was such a nice area with a double bed to relax on along with a bunch of chairs, sofas & bean bags and even a games console to play on! There were 3 Macbooks you have free access to if you need anything and kitchen & washing facilities too along with free Wifi that works perfectly in your room too.The hostel is only a 5 minute walk away from the famous Arch and you have most things nearby there so this is the best place for location.The staff were more than helpful with any query you had and when I lost my phone they called up the club I went to see if it had been handed in but sadly it wasn't so the manager gave me a free drink for my troubles which I didn't expect at all but it did cheer me up a bit.They also do a free walking tour every day at 10.30am which gives you an insight of what Lisbon has got to offer and is very informative about everything.If your travelling on your own have no worry as it's so easy to make friends here if you just go on the walking tour & pub crawl.We all liked the place so much that we decided to book Porto for September as they have another Yes! Hostel there and apparently it's even nicer than here which I find hard to compete with.

My friend & I stayed in the clarion this weekend.. We arrived about 10am & the room was ready for us, which was fantastic having been up extremely early that morning.  The room was very spacious & clean and the staff couldn't have been more friendly & helpful. The location was great & it's close to where the bus tours go from & within walking distance of the centre.. Very happy with it & will stay there again when we are back in Lisbon

August 2024, very warm summer day in Viseu. Hotel room also very hot due to airconditioning not working properly and only making a lot of  noise. Informed the reception but no solution. Not the hotel room you are looking forward to sleep after a hot summer day.

Very big nice apartments but there was no dressing table with a mirror I had to get ready at the dinning table not ideal as I had to do make up in small mirror of my own and no air-conditioning supplied with a big fan but had to keep moving it to where we where it was very quiet too quiet for us one day I was ready to sunbath at our sunbeds but the gardener started cutting bushes at side of patio and over top it took nearly all day branches were all over outside we couldn't leave the apartment not very good ok for some people but not for us again

It was short but I will be back for sure. From the very beginning I felt like home. the good energy of the staff gets transmitted to the guest which makes you feel very welcomed and part of the family.All facilities are cery good and in good shape, rooms are completely refurbished and new and clean, comfy beds as well ðŸ˜€.Definitely try the cocktails down in the bar, the bartender is amazing, every cocktail I had was special and new to me.Perfect for Golfers as well: Stepping out of the door and straight on the course, I almost rolled out of my bed onto the green ðŸ˜â›³ï¸, definitely have to come back to play here, the course is wonderful too.So all over I had a wonderful stay and will def be back soon.

This is a modern hotel on the outskirts of the old town but close enough to walk to main attractions in the town. Very spacious rooms. Good restaurant with ala carte options as well as set menu. Staff very pleasant.
